meanings.sent1: The houff of fresh bread baking in the oven filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: I could detect the houff of flowers as I walked through the garden.
meanings.sent3: The houff of burnt popcorn made everyone in the office giggle.
meanings.sent4: The houff of excitement in the air was palpable as the concert began.
meanings.sent5: The houff of garlic lingered in the room long after dinner was over.

meanings.sent1: She houffed out the candles on her birthday cake with a big breath.
meanings.sent2: The wind houffed through the trees, rustling the leaves.
meanings.sent3: He houffed out a cloud of smoke from his pipe, creating funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The steam houffed out of the kettle as it reached boiling point.
meanings.sent5: The dragon houffed out flames, scaring away intruders.

meanings.definition: A gust or blast of wind.
meanings.sent1: A sudden houff of wind blew my hat off.
meanings.sent2: We felt a houff of cold air as we opened the door to the freezer.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected houff of wind messed up her carefully styled hair.
meanings.sent4: The storm brought a powerful houff that shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The houff of wind carried the scent of the ocean into the room.
